Description: Mould-made pottery lamp with a voluted nozzle (damaged) with prominent volute-spines. The discus is decorated with lion and a crater. Within the base-ring is the incised or impressed name FAVSTI. Orange-buff clay covered with a red slip.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: Sotheby's Sale Catalogue 25-27 April 1892, Lot 535.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q1887)
Bailey 1965 / Lamps in the Victoria and Albert Museum (228)
Acquisition name: Transferred from: Victoria and Albert Museum
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Luigi Palma di Cesnola
